title: config.php settings '3rdpartyroot' & '3rdpartyurl' are misleading
body:
the ``config.php`` file contains two settings:

    /* path to the 3rdparty directory */
    "3rdpartyroot" => "",

     /* url to the 3rdparty directory, as seen by the browser */
    "3rdpartyurl" => "",

which from the comments would indicate that you should enter the actually directory to the ``3rdparty/`` directory and associated url to access this directory via http[s]. instead it appears that owncloud expects the directory and url to be the parent path of ``3rdparty/``. ie. settings the following in the ``config.php``

    "3rdpartyroot" => "<path to owncloud>/apps-3rdparty",
    "3rdpartyurl" => "/apps-3rdparty",

owncloud will actually try to access ``<path to owncloud>/apps-3rdparty/3rdparty`` and ``/apps-3rdparty/3rdparty``

i get the following in my apache error log:

    php fatal error:  require_once(): failed opening required 'phpass/passwordhash.php' (include_path='<path to owncloud>/lib:<path to owncloud>/config:<path to owncloud>/apps-3rdparty//3rdparty:<path to owncloud>/apps:<path to owncloud>/lib:.:/usr/share/php:/usr/share/pear:<path to owncloud>') in <path to owncloud>/lib/user/database.php on line 36, referer: https://<owncloud domain>/index.php/apps/files
    
this means two things...

1) the comments are misleading
2) there is no way to point to a directory containing the 3rdparty apps which isn't called ``3rdparty``
